page.title: 12Dialect
page.content: The first time you meet someone in Darfield the first thing you will notice will be the way they speak. Nearly everyone in Darfield speaks broad Yorkshire; and it takes people from other towns a long time to understand us well.We tend to shorten words and have special words for everyday things e.g. Spice means sweets, Spell means splinter, Ginnel means alleyway.Also we pronounce vowels differently saying both vowels seperately in words like soup and dead.The local people use 'tha' and 'thee' meaning 'you'. In our local paper there is a section written in broad Yorkshire,it is always very funny. Some people do not like the way we speak,but I think it is nice and makes Darfield different.
